intro: Cracca tridentata, commonly known as the three-toothed cracca, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its triangular stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and wastelands. Its leaves are lance-shaped with three distinct lobes, giving it its common name. Cracca tridentata is known for its resilience to harsh environmental conditions and is often used in traditional herbal medicine.
